content.webTitle: New York Times Company ad revenue plummets

fields.headline: New York Times Company ad revenue plummets
fields.bodyText: The New York Times Company has reported a 21% year-on-year fall in advertising revenues in November, with classified ad spend down 33.3%. The November report makes for grim reading with national advertising revenue down 21.1%, retail ads down 15.9% and classified advertising down 33.3%. Internet ad spend, once seen as a major growth area for publishers, dropped by 3.8%. Within the classified ad sector automotive ad revenue was down 31.3% year-on-year, real estate ads were down 34.4% and "help wanted" advertising was down 45.2%. Total company revenue decreased by 13.9% year-on-year last month, although circulation revenues increased 4.2%. Earlier this month the New York Times said it was planning to sell or mortgage its headquarters to raise $225m (£152m) and was looking at other financing options as it faces what senior executives have admitted will be one of its "most challenging years" in 2009. • To contact the MediaGuardian news desk email editor@mediatheguardian.com or phone 020 3353 3857.
